intro: Helixanthera subligustrina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helixanthera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent central tube. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
